treatment: Apply fungicides like Captan or Myclobutanil. Prune trees to improve air flow.
prevention: Clear fallen leaves in autumn. Plant resistant varieties.

treatment: Remove dead wood and cankers. Apply lime sulfur or copper fungicides.
prevention: Prune during dormancy. Avoid tree wounds and remove mummified fruit.

treatment: Apply Myclobutanil or protective sulfur sprays early in the spring.
prevention: Remove nearby Red Cedar trees or plant rust-resistant apple trees.

treatment: None needed. Your tree is healthy!
prevention: Maintain regular watering and organic fertilization.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Keep soil pH between 4.5 and 5.5 for best health.

treatment: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays at the first sign of white spots.
prevention: Increase sunlight penetration by pruning. Avoid nitrogen over-fertilization.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Watch for fruit flies and maintain consistent soil moisture.

treatment: Apply foliar fungicides like strobilurins or triazoles if infection is severe.
prevention: Practice crop rotation and use resistant hybrids. Manage crop residue.

treatment: Fungicides are usually only needed for high-value seed corn.
prevention: Plant resistant hybrids. This disease is favored by cool, moist air.

treatment: Use fungicides if lesions appear before silking. Rotate crops.
prevention: Deep plowing of infected residue. Use resistant corn varieties.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Maintain proper nitrogen levels and weed control.

treatment: Apply Mancozeb or Myclobutanil fungicides. Remove infected berries.
prevention: Full sun exposure and good drainage. Prune to improve ventilation.

treatment: No cure once established. Prune out dead wood and protect pruning wounds.
prevention: Avoid water stress. Minimize large pruning cuts in wet weather.

treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides after harvest to reduce spores.
prevention: Remove old leaves and vines. Ensure trellis allows for good airflow.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Regular pruning and balanced potassium fertilization.

treatment: No cure. Remove and destroy infected trees to prevent spread.
prevention: Control Psyllid insects using systemic insecticides. Use certified disease-free nursery stock.

treatment: Copper sprays can be used but can be toxic to peach leaves; use with caution.
prevention: Avoid high nitrogen levels. Plant resistant peach varieties.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Monitor for borers and maintain a good pruning schedule.

treatment: Apply copper-based sprays every 7-10 days in wet weather.
prevention: Use pathogen-free seeds. Avoid overhead irrigation.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Ensure well-draining soil and consistent watering.

treatment: Use fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering. Maintain high plant vigor with nitrogen.

treatment: Apply copper fungicides immediately. Destroy infected tubers.
prevention: Plant resistant cultivars. Do not leave cull piles in the field.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Rotate with non-solanaceous crops every 3 years.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Prune old canes annually and keep the patch weed-free.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Scout for beetles and maintain balanced P and K levels.

treatment: Apply horticultural oils or sulfur-based fungicides.
prevention: Provide adequate spacing for airflow. Water at the base, not leaves.

treatment: Remove and destroy old infected leaves. Use fungicide if severe.
prevention: Avoid excessive nitrogen in spring. Plant in full sun with good drainage.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Mulch with straw to keep berries off the soil.

treatment: Use copper-based bactericides. Remove infected lower leaves.
prevention: Use certified seeds. Rotate crops and avoid working in wet plants.

treatment: Prune lower leaves to prevent soil splash. Use Mancozeb fungicides.
prevention: Mulch around plants. Practice 3-year crop rotation.

treatment: Remove and bag infected plants. Apply chlorothalonil immediately.
prevention: Do not compost infected plants. Use blight-resistant varieties.

treatment: Apply calcium chloride sprays or fungicides. Increase greenhouse ventilation.
prevention: Keep humidity below 85%. Space plants widely for air circulation.

treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides like Copper or Mancozeb.
prevention: Keep foliage dry. Eliminate weeds like Nightshade around the garden.

treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or Neem oil. Increase humidity.
prevention: Avoid dusty conditions. Do not over-use nitrogen fertilizers.

treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin. Remove infected debris.
prevention: Improve airflow and keep foliage dry. Use crop rotation.

treatment: No cure. Pull out infected plants and control Whiteflies.
prevention: Use yellow sticky traps for Whiteflies. Plant resistant hybrids.

treatment: No cure. Destroy infected plants. Disinfect tools after use.
prevention: Do not smoke near plants (tobacco carries virus). Use certified seeds.

treatment: None needed.
prevention: Consistent watering to prevent blossom end rot.
